title: pickminer_
author: pickminer_
created_time: November 22, 2022, 01:29:42 PMLast edit: October 18, 2023, 01:31:27 PM by pickminer_
content: Pickminer v1.4.5 NVIDIA & AMD Mining SoftwarePickminer is an all-in-one NVIDIA & AMD mining software currently on Windows and Linux.You can enjoy your mining by creating templates, setting up their overclocking, and monitoring your ongoing mining thanks to an easy-to-use user interface.Coins+ RVN+ NEOX+ MEWC+ SATOX+ CLORE+ XNA+ FIRO+ ETHW+ ETCFeatures+ Support for Windows & Linux+ NVIDIA+ AMD+ Integrated overclocking tool+ User interfaceUsage & DevFeeWe have worked to make our software the easiest to use. However, if you want to know more, we have written an article that is available on our blog: https://pickminer.com/blog/set-up-your-mining-with-pickminer/The developer fee is currently fixed at 1.5%. The miner automatically mines for developers 2 minutes every 133 minutes.DownloadsDownload the software on our website - https://pickminer.com/downloadDownload the software on GitHub - https://github.com/Pickminer/Pickminer/releases/Useful linksOfficial website - https://pickminer.comFAQ - https://www.pickminer.com/discover#faq-sectionDiscord - https://discord.gg/VUNGF8r9BSChangeLog:v1.4.5NVIDIA: Increased KAWPOWNVIDIA: Increased FIROPOWAMD: Fix kernel FIROPOWAMD: Increased KAWPOWAMD: Increased FIROPOWSettings: Fix "power_limit"v1.4.4COIN : Neurai(XNA)v1.4.3FIX : Rig with only AMD GPU can run pickminer.AMD : RX 5000 are support.AMD : Polaris and Vegas not support.v1.4.2KAWPOW : Improve mining AMD and NVIDIAFIROPOW : Improve mining AMD and NVIDIAETHPOW : Fix mining on AMD, improve mining NVIDIAETC : Now availableFIX : Write logfilev1.4.1FIX : AMD kernel KAWPOW / FIROPOWv1.4.0COIN: ADD => ETHW / SATO / MEWCv1.3.1AMD: Fix kernel intensity selected.v1.3.0NVIDIA: Increase mining performance.NVIDIA:  Increase mining performance.AMD: Increase mining performance.AMD:  Increase mining performance.HiveOS: Fix mining NEOXA.UI: Now the setting supported can by manual selected.UI: Selecting a coin resets the list of pools.v1.2.1Network: Fix, reconnect to the pool.Mining: Workers no longer work if the connection is lost.FIX: Uptime format.v1.2.0NVIDIA: Increase performanceAMD:  Now compatibleHiveOS: Now compatiblev1.1.0COIN: Add NEOXA & FIRO mining.OVERCLOCK: Fix the default GPU settings value.NOTE: Pickminer now uses CUDA 12, you must download Windows v527.41 or Linux v525.60.13 driver version to mine with the software.v1.0.1UI: Open Terminal and Logs switches are by default True.LINUX: Add Boost library in the Pickminer package.WINDOWS: Add VC Redist detection.WINDOWS: Add launch software option after the installation.SOFTWARE: Add a time-out system when the pool connection failed Pickminer stops mining when the connection failed.NOTE: You must run launcher_pickminer to run the software and start mining.

comments.author: pickminer_
comments.body: NEW PICKMINER v1.1.0 UPDATEWe are pleased to announce the release of our new 1.1.0 version. This update adds Neoxa and Firo to the list of coins that you can mine with Pickminer.DownloadsDownload the software on our website - https://pickminer.com/downloadDownload the software on GitHub - https://github.com/Pickminer/Pickminer/releases/Useful linksOfficial website - https://pickminer.comFAQ - https://www.pickminer.com/discover#faq-sectionDiscord - https://discord.gg/VUNGF8r9BSWe can’t wait to have your comment on the software. Happy mining

comments.author: sxemini
comments.body: What is the advantage of your miner against other miners?The devfee is very high for those algos - we have a bunch of miners for this algos, so we have many choices.We appreciate your work.

comments.author: lijingang
comments.body: Hello pkminer, can you please help to add the ability to mine apepe on GPU? See please reply, thank youHello,I recently discovered a new interesting project (apepepow) that claims to be designed for the Monero (XMR) meme enthusiast community, developed by Monero developers. Is anyone interested in this project or has more information?I just read an article on a cryptocurrency blog about apepepow as an interesting meme coin for the monero community. I would like to know what people think about this project?New minable pow coin: apepepow (apepe)Monroe community meme coin, the first privacy meme coin, Monero developers, no pre-mining, no ICO, fair mining, let apepepow make pepe againAlgorithm: memehashWeb site: https://apepepow.comBlocks the browser: https://scan.apepepow.comMining Pool:: https://ekapool.com/apepe/bitcointalk:https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5455236.0Discord: https://discord.gg/s5ZgwcnGzTgithub:https://github.com/APEPEPOW/APEPEPOWcpuminer-memehash:https://github.com/APEPEPOW/cpuminer-memehash

comments.author: JayDDee
comments.body: Why do you have github? Github is for source code and you don't publish yours.Github repos with only binary releases are often used to spread malware infected miners.

comments.author: sxemini
comments.body: Quote from: JayDDee on October 10, 2023, 08:57:31 PMWhy do you have github? Github is for source code and you don't publish yours.Github repos with only binary releases are often used to spread malware infected miners.He also doesn´t answer to any question, you also must install this miner, very strange, the devfee is also too high.Too many red flags

comments.author: pickminer_
comments.body: Quote from: JayDDee on October 10, 2023, 08:57:31 PMWhy do you have github? Github is for source code and you don't publish yours.Github repos with only binary releases are often used to spread malware infected miners.We are using github to upload the binaries is easier than host a server only to download them.We can see how this is done with other mining software => T-Rex / Gminer / TeamRedminer and more.

comments.author: pickminer_
comments.body: Quote from: sxemini on October 11, 2023, 04:44:57 PMQuote from: JayDDee on October 10, 2023, 08:57:31 PMWhy do you have github? Github is for source code and you don't publish yours.Github repos with only binary releases are often used to spread malware infected miners.He also doesn´t answer to any question, you also must install this miner, very strange, the devfee is also too high.Too many red flagsAbout fees we can look at other software such as :* T-Rex: 1% `Developer fee is 1% (2% for Octopus, Autolykos2, and their dual mining modes).` (https://github.com/trexminer/T-Rex)* Teamredminer : GPU `Kawpow` => 2% (https://github.com/todxx/teamredminer)* Gminer: `kawpow, rvn, ravencoin` => 2% (https://github.com/develsoftware/GMinerRelease)So 1,5% it's not too much.We're sorry if you didn't get an answer earlier.I invite you to join us on discord and our developer will answer all your questions. (https://discord.com/invite/VUNGF8r9BS)

comments.author: JayDDee
comments.body: Quote from: pickminer_ on October 15, 2023, 07:12:35 PMQuote from: JayDDee on October 10, 2023, 08:57:31 PMWhy do you have github? Github is for source code and you don't publish yours.Github repos with only binary releases are often used to spread malware infected miners.We are using github to upload the binaries is easier than host a server only to download them.We can see how this is done with other mining software => T-Rex / Gminer / TeamRedminer and more.You have a web site, use that. Those miners have established reputations, you are a newcomer, a newcomer posting binarieswith no source code is always suspicious.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: JayDDee on October 15, 2023, 08:05:40 PMQuote from: pickminer_ on October 15, 2023, 07:12:35 PMQuote from: JayDDee on October 10, 2023, 08:57:31 PMWhy do you have github? Github is for source code and you don't publish yours.Github repos with only binary releases are often used to spread malware infected miners.We are using github to upload the binaries is easier than host a server only to download them.We can see how this is done with other mining software => T-Rex / Gminer / TeamRedminer and more.You have a web site, use that. Those miners have established reputations, you are a newcomer, a newcomer posting binarieswith no source code is always suspicious.Of course, there was a lot of fraud with viruses on github, but this miner has been known to the community for about a year and github has existed for a long time - about a year. If this were a scam, the miners would have written about it long ago.Any file must be checked at https://www.virustotal.com/gui/and it is better to mine on a separate PC so that viruses do not cause harm.

comments.author: JayDDee
comments.body: Quote from: FP91G on October 18, 2023, 10:55:46 AMOf course, there was a lot of fraud with viruses on github, but this miner has been known to the community for about a year and github has existed for a long time - about a year. If this were a scam, the miners would have written about it long ago.Any file must be checked at https://www.virustotal.com/gui/and it is better to mine on a separate PC so that viruses do not cause harm.I don't know them, user is still a newbie so hasn't contributed to any discussion, no history except this thread. How is this "known to the community"?Who have ever used this miner? No one has posted here, the thread is only one page with only 2 other posters beside you, me and the OP,  and neitherhas tried the miner.Miners are known for false positives so AV is meaningless. Many users are conditioned to automatically except all miners fromAV scanning making miners an ideal vehicle for real malware.It's all about reputation and the first rule is don't do things the way scammers do.If OP wants to keep their source closed they could open it under NDA to someone who is well known and respected.That would help build a reputation.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: JayDDee on October 19, 2023, 01:24:57 AMQuote from: FP91G on October 18, 2023, 10:55:46 AMOf course, there was a lot of fraud with viruses on github, but this miner has been known to the community for about a year and github has existed for a long time - about a year. If this were a scam, the miners would have written about it long ago.Any file must be checked at https://www.virustotal.com/gui/and it is better to mine on a separate PC so that viruses do not cause harm.I don't know them, user is still a newbie so hasn't contributed to any discussion, no history except this thread. How is this "known to the community"?Who have ever used this miner? No one has posted here, the thread is only one page with only 2 other posters beside you, me and the OP,  and neitherhas tried the miner.Miners are known for false positives so AV is meaningless. Many users are conditioned to automatically except all miners fromAV scanning making miners an ideal vehicle for real malware.It's all about reputation and the first rule is don't do things the way scammers do.If OP wants to keep their source closed they could open it under NDA to someone who is well known and respected.That would help build a reputation.I agree with you that antiviruses consider mining software to be malicious. You can wait until the developers make it as convenient as possible for users, but I still think that you should not run miners on your main work computer. On a separate mining farm, you can do experiments safely if the miner provides more hashrate.
